Description: Fragment of marble disc with three incised circular scratches; incised spiral; central piercing.
Curator's comments: This fragment is similar to fragment B 433a, however, it has a larger original size (Dm 23 cm). Due to its weight and the small central hole this fragment could have been, together with B 433a, a flywheel mass for tools (drill, lathe). If its context should be truly the Apollo temenos, this fragment could also be considered as a craftsman’s votive. Published (Koenigs 2007, 343 Cat. 41a)
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (B433b)
Koenigs 2007 / Archaische griechische Bauteile (Cat. no.41, p.343)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (AA.57) (Phase 3)
